title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {multiverse.internals: Internal Infrastructure for R-multiverse},   author = {William Michael Landau and Charlie Gao},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.1.8},   url = {https://r-multiverse.org/multiverse.internals/}, }

title: Internal Infrastructure for R-multiverse
text: multiverse.internals supports: Interactive tools help developers moderators contribute packages R-multiverse. Internal infrastructure support automation powers R-multiverse. Please visit https://r-multiverse.org/multiverse.internals/reference/index.html documentation. ask questions post issues package R-multiverse general, please visit https://github.com/r-multiverse/help.

title: Internal Infrastructure for R-multiverse
text: can install latest release multiverse.internals R-multiverse. can install development version GitHub :

title: Internal Infrastructure for R-multiverse
text: review_package() function helps contributors moderators check packages compliance R-multiverse policies. attempts run checks https://r-multiverse.org/review.html#automatic-acceptance can performed using package name URL alone. checks exhaustive, might feasible run , help manual reviews. Sometimes, review_package() may able run checks. cases, critical manually run review_license() "License:" string package’s DESCRIPTION file. R-multiverse requires package valid free open-source (FOSS) license.
code: library(multiverse.internals) review_package(   name = "webchem",   url = "https://github.com/ropensci/webchem" ) #> ✔ package webchem passed cursory checks for policy compliance. review_package(   name = "polars",   url = "https://github.com/pola-rs/r-polars" ) #> ✖ package polars did not pass cursory checks for policy compliance. Findings: #>  #> Package name 'polars' is different from the repository name in the URL 'https://github.com/pola-rs/r-polars' review_package(   name = "wrongpackage",   url = "https://github.com/ropensci/invalid-repo-name" ) #> ✖ package wrongpackage did not pass cursory checks for policy compliance. Findings: #>  #> URL 'https://github.com/ropensci/invalid-repo-name' returned HTTP error 404 | Not Found #>  #> WARNING: for security and/or practical reasons some pre-registration checks were skipped. Please manually check the package for compliance with R-multiverse policies. In particular, please check the license with multiverse.internals::review_license(). review_license("MIT + file LICENSE") #> ✔ License "MIT + file LICENSE" is okay. review_license("file LICENSE") #> ✖ License "file LICENSE" is prohibited.

title: Freeze dependencies — freeze_dependencies
text: NULL (invisibly)

title: Freeze dependencies — freeze_dependencies
text: freeze_dependencies() runs month-long dependency freeze phase Staging base R CRAN packages locked Staging universe next Production snapshot. establishes checks Staging universe using exact set dependencies used candidate freeze (see stage_candidates()). freeze_dependencies() copies Community repository packages.json Staging repository reset Staging process. also writes config.json file date targeted CRAN snapshot.

title: Freeze dependencies — freeze_dependencies
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ url_staging = "https://github.com/r-multiverse/staging" url_community = "https://github.com/r-multiverse/community" path_staging <- tempfile() path_community <- tempfile() gert::git_clone(url = url_staging, path = path_staging) gert::git_clone(url = url_community, path = path_community) freeze_dependencies(   path_staging = path_staging,   path_community = path_community ) } # }

title: Report package dependency issues — issues_dependencies
text: data frame one row package impacted upstream dependencies. element dependencies column nested list describing problems upstream. illustrate structure list, suppose Package tarchetypes depends package targets, packages jagstargets stantargets depend tarchetypes. addition, package targets problem R CMD check might cause problems tarchetypes packages downstream. status_dependencies() represents information following list:   general, returned list form:   upstream_culprit causes problems impacted_reverse_dependency direct dependencies direct_dependency_1 direct_dependency_2.
code: list(   jagstargets = list(targets = "tarchetypes"),   tarchetypes = list(targets = character(0)),   stantargets = list(targets = "tarchetypes") ) list(   impacted_reverse_dependency = list(     upstream_culprit = c("direct_dependency_1", "direct_dependency_2")   ) )

title: Report package check synchronization issues. — issues_synchronization
text: tibble one row per package following columns: package: Name package. synchronization: Synchronization status: "success" checks synchronized, "incomplete" checks still running R-universe GitHub Actions, "recent" package last published recently downstream checks may started yet.

title: Report package check synchronization issues. — issues_synchronization
text: R-universe automatically rechecks downstream packages upstream dependency increments version number. R-multiverse needs wait downstream checks finish makes decisions accepting packages Production. issues_synchronization() scrapes GitHub Actions API find R-universe checks still running package. addition, give rechecks enough time post GitHub Actions, flags packages published within last 5 minutes.

title: Report package check synchronization issues. — issues_synchronization

title: Package version issues. — issues_versions

title: Package version issues. — issues_versions
code: lines <- c(     "[",     " {",     " \"package\": \"package_unmodified\",",     " \"version_current\": \"1.0.0\",",     " \"hash_current\": \"hash_1.0.0\",",     " \"version_highest\": \"1.0.0\",",     " \"hash_highest\": \"hash_1.0.0\"",     " },",     " {",     " \"package\": \"version_decremented\",",     " \"version_current\": \"0.0.1\",",     " \"hash_current\": \"hash_0.0.1\",",     " \"version_highest\": \"1.0.0\",",     " \"hash_highest\": \"hash_1.0.0\"",     " },",     " {",     " \"package\": \"version_incremented\",",     " \"version_current\": \"2.0.0\",",     " \"hash_current\": \"hash_2.0.0\",",     " \"version_highest\": \"2.0.0\",",     " \"hash_highest\": \"hash_2.0.0\"",     " },",     " {",     " \"package\": \"version_unmodified\",",     " \"version_current\": \"1.0.0\",",     " \"hash_current\": \"hash_1.0.0-modified\",",     " \"version_highest\": \"1.0.0\",",     " \"hash_highest\": \"hash_1.0.0\"",     " }",     "]"   )   versions <- tempfile()   writeLines(lines, versions)   out <- issues_versions(versions)   str(out) #> 'data.frame':	2 obs. of  2 variables: #>  $ package : chr  "version_decremented" "version_unmodified" #>  $ versions:List of 2 #>   ..$ :List of 4 #>   .. ..$ version_current: chr "0.0.1" #>   .. ..$ hash_current   : chr "hash_0.0.1" #>   .. ..$ version_highest: chr "1.0.0" #>   .. ..$ hash_highest   : chr "hash_1.0.0" #>   ..$ :List of 4 #>   .. ..$ version_current: chr "1.0.0" #>   .. ..$ hash_current   : chr "hash_1.0.0-modified" #>   .. ..$ version_highest: chr "1.0.0" #>   .. ..$ hash_highest   : chr "hash_1.0.0"
